alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 10:59AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Chesterfield and southeastern Henrico Counties through 1130 AM EDT... At 1059 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chester, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. In addition, Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chester around 1110 AM EDT. Bellwood around 1120 AM EDT. Bensley around 1125 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Meadowville, Drewrys Bluff and Centralia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Henrico
